answers.author: John Garvison
answers.text:
What I just recently did for an accounting software Request For Proposals, is I went to Google and spent almost 7 hours Googling accounting software vendors, and then sent the RFP documents to their business addresses. This is a lengthy and time-consuming process, but unless your state or local association has a centralized purchasing website that vendors can look at potential business opportunities, then the old method I utilized may be the best for you. 
In addition, we published the solicitation to our organization's website too.

After you post the RFP to your Website there's a great chance that Onvia (www.onvia.com) and other bid firms will  distribute the announcement to their subscribers (web development firms).

answers.author: Adam Carpenetti
answers.text:
When we did ours a couple years ago, I was amazed at the response when we only posted to our website and local newspaper.  I think some RFP mining company must have picked it up and redistributed to other regions.  When we posted in Christiansburg, VA, we had several responses from the west coast and even a couple from the British Columbia region.  It might help to leave it posted an extra couple weeks just so more "mining" companies can pick it up.
